caption: I don't think I can trust ratings anymore, ordered chicken tikka masala today, no indian would make it like this. With sweet coconut milk, pale yellow and with capsicum. Unbelievable.
Good customer service - Sply, the guy (who picked up the call for my order queries) was very calm and sweet. The food quality is good too. I do recommend it :)
Excellent service :), loved the food quality and quantity. I do recommend it..!!
The food is good but packaging needs to be worked on.. had a side dish of samosa chaat.. can you believe they packed it in a paper box and by the time I reached home the soggy bag just gave away.
Great food Authentic. Prompt Will definitely reorder We did talk to the manager,Smith, before ordering. He was very helpful
Great value for the price! Probably the best Indian food I’ve had in Chicago in a while.
Really great food! Definitely spicy, but balanced and creamy and delicious. We got the Korma and the Tikka. Will order again for sure!

Let me tell you the story about the lovely place called curry house. I ordered through uber eats; vegetable biryana, lacha paratha and chicken tikka masala. So, the surprise was; The biryani had no vegetables with 2 cubes of ‘panner’ which were lost in rice, and half a string of broccoli which looked so sad that I felt sorry for it. . Yes, of course it's on discount because it's a hoax. Laccha paratha was replaced with oiled roti bread, and the side that came with it was disgustingly spicy. My fellow American, there is a difference between chicken tikka masala and tandoori chicken. If you’re getting chunks of grilled chicken in ‘tikka Marsala’ it’s a cheat (especially if it’s colored pink or reddish). Laccha paratha, is very different from the food this restaurant peddles. Above all, their portions are amazingly small. Happy eating Chicago :)  Update 12/27- A good guy called me, apologies for the food and sent me food to correct. But he had been texting me to Change my review. Please don't contact me to update for a favourable review. Thank you for the food ( I paid for)

I was sorely disappointed with my meal from Curry Theory. I was craving Chicken Tikka Masala. So imagine my disappointment when I received a bland, pink-colored curry made with sweetened coconut milk. What a shame - any Indian knows that there is no place for coconut milk in Chicken Tikka Masala. The palak paneer was average. The uttapam was fine. The sambar was totally bland, underseasoned, oily, and inedible. I was promised delivery in 35 minutes. I took 100 minutes. Came cold. I can say with much confidence that this is FAR from the "best" in Chicago. Would not recommend.
The kebabs are exquisite, and the naans are really delicious. The goat biryani is also really amazing. It is definitely one of the best Indian kitchens in Chicago
Good food and a wide variety of Indian options to choose from
Really tasty authentic indian food, the curries are really tasty and a must try.
I order food from here recently and it is by far one of the best indian food I have tasted in chicago. I personally love the kharai paneer and Aloo Gobi with the lacha partha
Amazing food, the chicken curries are delicious 😋. I personally love the haryali tikka and chicken dum biryani!
Amazing food 😋, loved the chicken biryani and chat items a lot. The naans are so fluffy and perfect and fun to eat.

Ordered, got email confirmation, went to pickup place to get the food after it was supposed to be ready. Apparently, they didn’t start making the food until we arrived and didn’t even know we had an order although we had a confirmation email from Google. Had to ask them multiple times to actually get the food.

The lamb vindaloo was quite good and very spicy. As it should be, just know this place is bringing the heat. I also had the garlic naan which was great and the samosas. The only flaw was I thought the samosas were a little oversalted to my taste, but overall the food was good and I will definitely order from here again.

Worst Indian food ever. Blatant violation of Covid social distancing restrictions. I can only imagine how congested it is in the kitchen. Avoid picking food from any restaurant that is serving out of this location it’s a Covid 19 trap
So far the best meal from here, I ordered chicken kolhapuri-it was the best. Chicken dum biryani was okay okay...

I ate in many indian restaurants in Downtown chicago and this is one of the best I have tried in downtown chicago. Very authentic tastes. The menu accommodates all different regional foods of India, that everyone can relate to their own regional taste and food. We ordered for group of 4 ppl toofani tikka (as I am big fan of tandoori stuff) ,frankies & pav bhaaji(to taste the touch of street food) ,sandwiches(american-india combo sandwich) , lal maas curry and mutton biryani. The order was on time and the service was very friendly to let us know the food was picked up by driver for delivery.Food arrived piping hot and in good time. The menu contains a good number of house specialities which are a cut above the normal menu offerings. I tried one of the house specialities and it was delicious.  If you are around must try place.
Yesterday I ordered 1 Karahi Chicken and one Pepper fried chicken, and the food was awesome as always.  The unique flavor and balance of the spices is unprecedented to me.  Thanks Curry Theory
Never been to the restaurant, but have enjoyed several delivery meals. Good quality

If you want to experience authentic indian food in the loop,  this is the place to go. Tried their veg biryani, paneer tikka masala, aloo gobi, ragada chat, samosa chat every item is  flavourful and up to the mark. Kudos to the chef and the Curry Theory team.
Ordered via Doordash, but it never felt like I was eating at home. Instant teleportation to grandma's house! Can't recommend enough, and can't rate highly enough 👌🏼
Great Food ! Amazing Toofani Tikka & Egg fried rice ...
Authentic. Delicious nan bread. Ordered the Aloo Gobi and the Chicken Tikka. Very spicy dishes. Really enjoyed.
Food is top notch 😋 worth every penny !

I ordered a couple of times from Curry Theory, the food is fresh, packed Nicely and has a nice portion size. Thumbs up to Pramod and Lucas for this great quality. I'll definitely order again. Also don't forget the lamb biryani, it's real nice.
The best authentic Indian food option in downtown.. everything in the order tasted amazing and avoids a trip to devon.
Malai kabab was great

Panner Frankie was little off could have added more salt and spice. Chicken malai was good as per my friends opinion(I am a vegetarian). Appreciate the eco friendly packaging very much. Would try some other dish next time. Hoping to give another star in the next order :)

Worth the wait!!! Ordered food twice on Friday's and it was definitely worth the wait. Food was delicious and cooked with right spice and flavor. I didn't see any coloring agent or any excess oil in the food. Ordered starters and main dishes twice in the row. Their chettinad curry was amazing and had a unique flavor. Loved the kebabs and biryani which is a must try. Rice was cooked well and didn't feel it was overdone or was used too many spice, that's rare to be seen in Indian restaurants. Food was delivered a bit late but the owner apologized personally and complimented our order with a free dessert. I must say that was a nice gesture from the restaurant team. Again, food being of high quality, with less food coloring and no excess oil seem to be a healthy option for an Indian food take out place. I would recommend this restaurant to all and will order food again. - Nisha Rao & Krishna Darla

One of the best Indian food that I have tasted in a long time!! thank you! very authentic taste for all the dishes that I ordered!!  I have one input, please use some different bread for paneer tikka sandwich as the current one cannot handle the paneer tikka and the other fillings especially when it is ordered to-go.
I am glad that I found this restaurant while my visit to Chicago last weekend. Food was delicious, loved their Toofani tikka and chicken tikka Franky.

I recently ordered from Curry Theory on my birthday and it was an amazing treat for my friends. Loved the food. Ordered thrice since then. The toofani chicken and palak paneer are lipsmacking and had authentic spices. Kudos !
Good food!!!

With all the fuss going around about this restaurant thought to give it a try and now I wish I could give more than 5 stars to the food and service they provided. I ordered Mutton Biryani, Madrasi chicken and Naan.. I am a big fan of Biryani and I could easily tell is it a fresh or not and Biryani I got looked like fresh from the bandi and tasked like real Hyderabadi Mutton Biryani and they have adjusted spice levels accordingly as I have requested and my wife ordered Madrasi Chicken and it was too good too as it was not too spicy or less spicy it was soo perfect. With no second thought I would say this was one of the best food I had for a long time, really loved the food and definitely will refer this restaurant..
Tried the paneer frankie and it tasted amazing. Will definitely try other items on the menu.
Great new spot for Indian delicacies. Me and my family thoroughly enjoyed our order of Frankie and Toofani Kabab. We would definitely order from Curry Theory again.
This is one of the best foods I had in recent times. Mutton biryani is awesome, worth trying if you are around :)
Chicken Kebabs are awesome and biryani is fabulous
Very nice food. Biryani was awesome and Frankie’s too. Definitely worth a try if you are around.
I had Frankie and mutton curry along with mutton biryani tastes really good The best part  they avoided food colors 🤘🤘 and I can feed my little ones without hesitation  which was a great initiative
Tasty food especially paneer sandwich. Will definitely try again.

Food is just amazing. I’ve felt in love with Indian cuisine some time ago, and since then I’ve been trying several different restaurants. In the middle of the way I’ve found everything, but surely nothing like Curry Theory. The spices are balanced in a way that it was unique to me. Will definitely order again !

Great quality Indian food! Absolutely loved the food and the selection of items in the menu. Frankies and Potato chips are the best.Will definitely order again and recommend this place to our friends!
Fantastic food and great flavors. Definitely a great choice for cozy dinners and affordable lunches. Cant wait to try other items on the menu.

We ordered food from Curry Theory on a weekend while our friends were visiting. We ordered vegetarian and non vegetarian curries (paneer, mushroom, chicken, lalmaas) along with appetizers, naans, wrap/frankie, sandwich, biryani(veg/non-veg) for all of us over 2 days to have a variety. All items arrived great, well packaged without any spills.  Great quality of food, very fresh and delicious to the palatte. All of us enjoyed the food; the taste is flavorful and rich. Biryaani, naans and curry are my favorite ! Great job, will keep coming back 👍
Very tasty and authentic food especially the chicken tikka and biryani. I am looking forward to trying more items on their menu.
Amazing Indian food! Best in town so far :)

Was looking for indian food on grubhub and found this new restaurant and wanted to give it a try.  My impressions: 1. I am glad they used eco-friendly paper packaging. Thanks for not using plastic.  2. Quality of the food was very good like a high priced restaurant while the rates were reasonable.  3. Delivery was on time and the food felt fresh, nice and warm.
Good food. Nice biryani.
Best place for indian food in Chicago downtown
Worth it! Well packaged and tasty food!!
